page.title: 08St.Mary's ,North Mymms.
page.content: North Mymms is recorded in the {Domesday Book,}1086,where it is called Mimmine.The first vicar was created in 1237 and it is thought that parts of his church are part of the present building which goes back to the early 14th century. The following groups are connected with the church:Sunday School, Pramsters, Bellringers and Marriage Preparation.There are 4 services every Sunday with congregations of about 200.Last year there were about 40 Christenings and 35 Weddings. The west doorway was the most beautiful feature in the Church but it would cost Â£20,000 to restore.A peal of 8 bells has just been rehung for the first time in the history of the Church.
